common_issues.title: Pieces OS connection and performance issues
common_issues.description: Users report connection issues with Pieces OS from remote environments like Docker, often due to server listening interface changes. Workarounds include custom URLs and configuration. High RAM and CPU usage is another concern, potentially linked to Live Context. Mitigation involves disabling the feature or restarting Pieces OS while optimizations are underway.

related_issues.title: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container)
related_issues.text: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container) ### Software VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.02 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I'm having the same problem as this: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269 Using VS Code project within a docker container and getting this message: > Woops! It seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment & Pieces for VS Code cannot connect to Pieces OS. Please refer to our documentation on how to resolve this issue. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffeb53fd-0787-4bc2-9faf-c5f3d179294b) Pieces OS version: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640d35af-6106-4717-9269-c51205ff23fb) I followed this guide but with no luck: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance LAN IP: VS Code settings, pieces custom URL: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaed7eb8-36e7-49cb-b6e0-84271adb8027) What else can I try? Thanks! ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation **Key Points Raised:** * @malanciault reported an issue where they were unable to connect to Pieces OS from VSCode, even with no project open. * This issue persisted even after attempting to connect using the custom URL `http://192.168.0.129:39300`. * The issue appeared to be specific to remote projects hosted in Docker. * Initial troubleshooting suggested the problem might be related to the Pieces documentation being outdated regarding the default port used by Pieces OS. * Further investigation revealed that changes in the latest Pieces OS release related to security resulted in the server listening only on the loopback interface by default. * This caused issues for remote connections from DevContainers, as they could not access the server on the loopback interface. * As a workaround, a complex configuration involving a custom DNS entry and hosts file modifications was suggested. * A patch was planned to allow changing the server's listening interface. * The Pieces for VSCode extension was updated to address the issue and allow for automatic detection of Pieces OS without a custom URL. **Problems Identified:** * Outdated documentation regarding the default port used by Pieces OS. * Change in server behavior in the latest Pieces OS release causing connection issues for remote clients. * Inability of the webview tool windows to resolve the `host.docker.internal` address. **Proposed/Implemented Solutions:** * Provide updated documentation with the correct default port information. * Patch the server to allow listening on all interfaces. * Update the VSCode extension to automatically detect Pieces OS and remove the need for a custom URL. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The issue has been resolved in the Pieces for VSCode extension version 2.0.2. * Users should update the extension and remove the custom URL to resolve the connection issue. **Additional Notes:** * The conversation highlights the importance of clear documentation and communication of changes in software releases. * It also showcases the collaborative effort between the Pieces team and users to identify and resolve issues.

related_issues.title: Failed to load resource: net::ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED     http://127.0.0.1:1000/.well-known/health
related_issues.text:
Failed to load resource: net::ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED     http://127.0.0.1:1000/.well-known/health
### Software

Web Extension

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Chrome browser slows to a crawl while hundreds of these errors are issued:
Failed to load resource: net::ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED     http://127.0.0.1:1000/.well-known/health   

Disabling the extension stops it, re-enabling invokes it again
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* SteveW555 reported an issue where the Chrome extension fills the developer console with errors.

**Problems Identified:**

* The issue is duplicated with [Multiple well-known/health api call during reload](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/569) and [Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/562).

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The bug will be fixed in the upcoming release of the extension, scheduled for today or within the next one to two days.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is closed as a duplicate of [Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/562). The fix will be included in the upcoming extension release.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation on Pieces OS High Memory Usage

**Key Points Raised:**

* Pieces OS, a local server for Pieces suite, consumes high memory and sometimes even CPU resources.
* Memory usage can exceed 2GB even with no models installed, causing performance issues.
* Live Context feature seems to contribute to the increased resource consumption.

**Problems Identified:**

* High RAM and CPU usage impacting overall system performance.
* Users have to disable Pieces OS to prevent slowdown.
* Memory leak suspected.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Turning off Live Context feature to reduce RAM usage.
* "Optimize Memory" option to free up some RAM.
* Working on improvements for better performance.
* Offering individual support to diagnose and resolve issues.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue still ongoing with no fixed timeline for complete resolution.
* Some users have stopped using Pieces due to high resource demands.

**Notes:**

* Pieces OS acknowledges the challenges of building on-device ML with limitations on resource consumption.
* They are actively working on improvements and appreciate users' patience.

**Additional Points:**

* Issue has been ongoing since April 2024 and is still relevant as of November 2024.
* Users have reported the issue on different operating systems, including Windows, Linux, and MacOS.

common_issues.title: Pieces performance issues and errors
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces being unresponsive, using excessive RAM, and displaying errors. This occurs when analyzing large codebases or using features like Copilot. Proposed solutions include restarting Pieces, disabling Live Context, and waiting for updates addressing memory leaks and performance optimization.

related_issues.title: Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
related_issues.text:
Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

In UltraEdit I opened the python script available at https://github.com/eldraco/domain_analyzer/blob/master/domain_analyzer.py. I opened the Pieces plugin and using default settings prompted it to describe the script: "What does this Python script do?" The UE plugin never returns any content and seems to be unresponsive. 

In Pieces Desktop, I do see the result, however interaction with it is latent indicating some sort of continual background processing even though the LLM has completed processing. Additionally, there seem to be significant scroll issues, and the code view doesn't appear to be calculating line numbers correctly, showing many empty lines after line 1,918, when line 2,837 is the last line in the file.

Finally, the Pieces Desktop code view shows a wrap in the line number margin.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9be69032-f2e2-4379-843c-cd0bf14da63a)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* User @bschwenk reported an issue with context and line number wrapping in Gemini 1.5 flash and gpt4o. 
* The issue appears specific to a file downloaded by the user. 

**Problems Identified:**

1. **Context Issue:** The file is not getting included in the context, causing Gemini to request the file again. 
2. **Line Number Wrapping:** Line numbers are wrapping incorrectly. 

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces and @sam-at-pieces are investigating and working on a fix for the context issue. 
* The fix is expected to be included in the next release of Pieces. 
* No solution mentioned for the line number wrapping issue. 

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is being addressed by the Pieces team. 
* A fix for the context issue is expected in the next release. 
* The status of the line number wrapping issue is unclear. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The author also linked to some relevant resources:

    * Existing Issues: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues
    * Documentation: https://docs.pieces.app
    * YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/@getpieces

related_issues.title: Copilot is not giving any feedback
related_issues.text:
Copilot is not giving any feedback
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 3.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The copilot is not generating anything, it just keeps on loading.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Copilot Response Issues

**Key Points:**

* @gittydia reported an issue where Pieces Copilot responded with "I'm sorry. Something went wrong with the processing. Please..."
* This issue is similar to other reported issues related to Copilot response problems.
* The issue has been triaged and routed to the appropriate Pieces team member.
* A potential fix is expected to be included in the upcoming PiecesOS release 11.0.4 (estimated release date: Thursday).

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces Copilot responses are failing with an error message.
* This issue has been affecting multiple users.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A fix is being implemented in the upcoming PiecesOS release 11.0.4.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The fix is currently being tested and is expected to be released on Thursday.
* Users are requested to report back if the issue persists after the release.

**Additional Information:**

* Related issues and resources are provided for reference.

common_issues.title: Pieces Copilot response errors and UI issues
common_issues.description: Users report Copilot not responding, showing error messages, or experiencing lag. Issues include invalid API keys, problems with specific models, and UI glitches in code view. Solutions involve updating Pieces, removing or registering OpenAI API keys, switching models, and waiting for upcoming releases with fixes.

related_issues.title: Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
related_issues.text:
Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

hi i have been using it for 2 days but for the last 2 hours the desktop and visual studio extension are not working. 

No matter what I type, it gives me this error. There was an update message for the app, it was about installing a version, I installed it but it didn't fix it.
always the same message 
visual studio ide 2022 17.12 
windows 10 pro
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c64d85bd-eb1a-4f1c-a25e-570c9a55ccd1)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/55b600a6-95f4-4e71-aee1-1b1ce8b6599c)


## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users experiencing issues with the product, including:
    * Invalid API keys
    * Errors with Claude and Gemini models
    * High rate limits
* Removing the OpenAI API key as a temporary workaround 

**Problems Identified:**

* Outdated version of the product (11.0.2)
* Invalid or outdated OpenAI API keys
* Issues with specific models (Claude and Gemini)
* High rate limits for non-signed-in users

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Update to the latest version (11.0.3)
* Remove the OpenAI API key
* Switch to the GPT4o model
* Sign in to Pieces for a higher rate limit
* Register the OpenAI API key (investigation ongoing)

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue appears to be resolved for most users who have updated to the latest version and/or removed their OpenAI API key.
* The team is investigating the issue with API keys and registration.

**Additional Notes:**

* The team is actively looking into the issues with the Claude and Gemini models.
* It is recommended to switch to the GPT4o model if you are experiencing problems with other models.

related_issues.title: Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
related_issues.text:
Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

In UltraEdit I opened the python script available at https://github.com/eldraco/domain_analyzer/blob/master/domain_analyzer.py. I opened the Pieces plugin and using default settings prompted it to describe the script: "What does this Python script do?" The UE plugin never returns any content and seems to be unresponsive. 

In Pieces Desktop, I do see the result, however interaction with it is latent indicating some sort of continual background processing even though the LLM has completed processing. Additionally, there seem to be significant scroll issues, and the code view doesn't appear to be calculating line numbers correctly, showing many empty lines after line 1,918, when line 2,837 is the last line in the file.

Finally, the Pieces Desktop code view shows a wrap in the line number margin.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9be69032-f2e2-4379-843c-cd0bf14da63a)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* User @bschwenk reported an issue with context and line number wrapping in Gemini 1.5 flash and gpt4o. 
* The issue appears specific to a file downloaded by the user. 

**Problems Identified:**

1. **Context Issue:** The file is not getting included in the context, causing Gemini to request the file again. 
2. **Line Number Wrapping:** Line numbers are wrapping incorrectly. 

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces and @sam-at-pieces are investigating and working on a fix for the context issue. 
* The fix is expected to be included in the next release of Pieces. 
* No solution mentioned for the line number wrapping issue. 

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is being addressed by the Pieces team. 
* A fix for the context issue is expected in the next release. 
* The status of the line number wrapping issue is unclear. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The author also linked to some relevant resources:

    * Existing Issues: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues
    * Documentation: https://docs.pieces.app
    * YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/@getpieces

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of Pieces OS connection issues:** The most active ticket (#550) highlights persistent problems with Pieces OS connecting from remote environments like Docker. Focus on resolving this issue to improve user experience, especially for developers working in containerized setups.

**Investigate and address Pieces performance issues:** Tickets #150, #586, and others indicate concerns about high RAM usage, CPU spikes, and unresponsiveness. Allocate resources to identify memory leaks, optimize performance, and ensure Pieces can handle large codebases efficiently.

**Improve Copilot stability and responsiveness:** Several tickets (#561, #584, #586) report Copilot errors, unresponsiveness, and UI glitches. Focus on enhancing Copilot's error handling, API key management, and overall stability to provide a seamless AI assistance experience.

**Review and update documentation:** Ticket #550 reveals outdated documentation regarding Pieces OS default port. Conduct a thorough review and update of all documentation to ensure accuracy and clarity, reducing user confusion and support requests.

**Enhance communication about upcoming releases:** Keep users informed about bug fixes and improvements in upcoming releases. This can be done through release notes, blog posts, or in-app notifications. Transparency about upcoming fixes can manage user expectations and reduce support inquiries.
